sec.title: International Centre of Nursing Ethics (ICNE) News
sec.p: The International Centre of Nursing Ethics (ICNE) is based in the Faculty of Health and Medical Sciences at the University of Surrey, Guildford, UK. It enables those engaged in all aspects of nursing ethics – empirical and philosophical – across the globe to collaborate on research and scholarship. In addition to initiating and promoting international research, the Centre also hosts an annual conference, regular ethics seminars and a post-graduate professional ethics summer school. Go to: http://www.nursing-ethics.org/

sec.title: Nursing ethics blogs
sec.p: Readers may be interested to explore these links:

sec.title: Bioethics/Medical ethics/Global Health Bioethics blogs
sec.p: Readers may also be interested to explore the following link:

sec.title: BioEdge
sec.p: BioEdge is edited by Michael Cook, who is based in Melbourne, Australia, and provides regular updates and news regarding bioethics around the world.

sec.title: Global Health Ethics
sec.p: The Global Health Ethics web site offers a virtual space for dialogue on shared ethical concerns and support on unique ethical dilemmas. This website is available in several languages.

sec.title: Amnesty International
sec.p: The Amnesty International Health and Human Rights web site offers news, information and resources relating to health and human rights. Readers can sign up for the fortnightly electronic bulletin for health professionals and access links to related web sites.

sec.title: The European Association of Centres of Medical Ethics (EACME)
sec.p: This web site provides information about health care ethics activities across Europe.
